title: Dumbo: The Eviction Notice Strikes Back
plot_outline: Dumbo faces a typical day that goes from bad to worse when authority figure abuses power. What starts as a simple attempt to pay overdue rent becomes a meditation on rock bottom has a basement as Dumbo encounters the usual cast of neighborhood characters and discovers that even small victories come with a price.

scenes.title: Rock Bottom Has a Basement
scenes.action: Dumbo begins their day with the usual routine of avoiding responsibility and managing expectations. The catalyst for today's adventure presents itself in the form of a phone call they can't ignore. Despite every instinct screaming "don't get involved," circumstances and poor judgment combine to draw Dumbo into the situation.

dialogue.speaker: Dumbo
dialogue.line: Can we just pretend this is someone else's problem?
dialogue.tone: defeated resignation with occasional flashes of frustrated energy
dialogue.subtext: revealing more about their pain than intended

dialogue.speaker: Dumbo
dialogue.line: Can we solve this with minimal effort on my part?
dialogue.tone: defeated resignation with occasional flashes of frustrated energy
dialogue.subtext: desperately wants to be proven wrong about people

dialogue.speaker: Buzz
dialogue.line: Things just keep getting worse.
dialogue.tone: slurred optimism fighting against bitter reality
dialogue.subtext: secretly hoping someone will save them

dialogue.speaker: Dumbo
dialogue.line: Why do I let myself get talked into these things?
dialogue.tone: defeated resignation with occasional flashes of frustrated energy
dialogue.subtext: revealing more about their pain than intended

character_appearances.Madame Zelda: Tired, worn down, but still clinging to whatever dignity remains

scenes.title: When Bad Gets Worse
scenes.action: The situation escalates when a misunderstanding escalates out of control. What seemed like a manageable problem reveals itself to be connected to larger issues involving family dysfunction. Dumbo realizes they're in deeper than anticipated and that their usual strategy of "ignore it and hope it goes away" won't work this time.

dialogue.speaker: Madame Zelda
dialogue.line: I have a bad feeling about this.
dialogue.tone: weary sarcasm
dialogue.subtext: secretly hoping someone will save them

dialogue.speaker: Madame Zelda
dialogue.line: This is not what I signed up for.
dialogue.tone: weary sarcasm
dialogue.subtext: terrified of being vulnerable again

dialogue.subtext: secretly hoping someone will save them

scenes.title: Same Shit, Different Day
scenes.action: The episode concludes with Dumbo having learned nothing from their experience but somehow finding themselves in a slightly different variation of the same situation they started in. Victory is redefined as "not making things significantly worse," and the audience is reminded that some problems don't get solved—they just get replaced with new problems.

dialogue.speaker: Dumbo
dialogue.line: Look, I didn't ask for this shit to happen...
dialogue.tone: defeated resignation with occasional flashes of frustrated energy
dialogue.subtext: terrified of being vulnerable again

dialogue.speaker: Madame Zelda
dialogue.line: Things just keep getting worse.
dialogue.tone: weary sarcasm
dialogue.subtext: protecting themselves from further disappointment

dialogue.speaker: Dumbo
dialogue.line: I need a pizza and a nap, in that order.
dialogue.tone: defeated resignation with occasional flashes of frustrated energy
dialogue.subtext: terrified of being vulnerable again
